snippet: With the end of the Cold War, Russia ceased being a concentration of choice among future foreign policy professionals. The dearth is being felt now.
abstract: Russian Pres Vladimir V Putin's takeover of Russia has shifted attention to America's experts on Russia and highlighted important shifts in attitudes and opinions of American academics and policy makers; some experts fear that dearth of talent in field and ineffectual management from White House have combined to create unsophisticated and cartoonish view of a former superpower and potential threat.
lead_paragraph: With the end of the Cold War, Russia ceased being a concentration of choice among future foreign policy professionals. The dearth is being felt now.

headline.main: Russia Experts See Thinning Ranks’ Effect on U.S. Policy
headline.print_headline: Russia Experts See Ranks Thin, and an Effect on U.S. Policy
